meanings.definition: To exert force on (someone or something) in order to move them away from oneself.
meanings.sent1: She pushed the door open with all her might.
meanings.sent2: He pushed the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat pushed the toy mouse around the house for fun.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind pushed the leaves off the tree.
meanings.sent5: The determined hiker pushed through the thick forest to reach the mountaintop.

meanings.definition: To promote or encourage the development or progress of (something).
meanings.sent1: The teacher pushed her students to do their best in the exam.
meanings.sent2: The company pushed for innovation in their products.
meanings.sent3: The coach pushed the team to train harder for the upcoming match.
meanings.sent4: The mentor pushed her mentee to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The parents pushed their child to explore new opportunities for growth.

meanings.definition: To make an effort to advance or achieve something.
meanings.sent1: She pushed herself to finish the race despite feeling tired.
meanings.sent2: He pushed through the challenges to reach his goal.
meanings.sent3: The student pushed to improve their grades before the end of the semester.
meanings.sent4: The entrepreneur pushed to launch their startup successfully.
meanings.sent5: The artist pushed boundaries to create unique and impactful artwork.
